properties.name: camel.component.reactive-streams.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.reactive-streams.backpressure-strategy
properties.description: The backpressure strategy to use when pushing events to a slow subscriber.

properties.name: camel.component.reactive-streams.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.reactive-streams.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the reactive-streams component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.reactive-streams.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.reactive-streams.reactive-streams-engine-configuration
properties.description: To use an existing reactive stream engine configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.reactive.streams.engine.ReactiveStreamsEngineConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.reactive-streams.service-type
properties.description: Set the type of the underlying reactive streams implementation to use. The implementation is looked up from the registry or using a ServiceLoader, the default implementation is DefaultCamelReactiveStreamsService

properties.name: camel.component.reactive-streams.thread-pool-max-size
properties.description: The maximum number of threads used by the reactive streams internal engine.

properties.name: camel.component.reactive-streams.thread-pool-min-size
properties.description: The minimum number of threads used by the reactive streams internal engine.

properties.name: camel.component.reactive-streams.thread-pool-name
properties.description: The name of the thread pool used by the reactive streams internal engine.
